alert.note: Alert for Bureau (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 2:18PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Henry and northwestern Bureau Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 218 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sheffield, or 10 miles northeast of Kewanee, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Buda around 225 PM CDT. Wyanet around 235 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Princeton. This includes Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 36 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
